<h4>Description:</h4>
<div class="list">
Adds a new setting<br />
</div>
<h4>Name:</h4>
<div class="list">
add<br />
</div>
<h4>Param:</h4>
<div class="list">
$module - the module name<br />
$name - the name of the setting<br />
$description - a description for the setting (will appear in the config)<br />
$mode - 'edit', 'noedit', or 'hide'<br />
$type - 'color', 'number', 'text', or 'options'<br />
$options - a list of values that the setting can be, semi-colon delimited
(optional)<br />
$intoptions - int values corresponding to $options; if empty, the values from
$options will be what is stored in the database (optional)<br />
$admin - the permission level needed to change this setting (default: mod)
(optional)<br />
$help - a help file for this setting; if blank, will use a help topic with the
same name as this setting if it exists (optional)<br />
</div>

===mixed registerChangeListener ( string <var>$settingName</var>, callable <var>$callback</var>, mixed <var>$data</var> )===

Adds listener callback which will be called if given $settingName changes.

The callback has following signature:
<code>function callback($value, $data)</code>
$value: new value of the setting
$data:  optional data variable given on register

Example usage:
<code>
$this->setting->registerChangeListener("some_setting_name", function($value) {
	// ...
} );
</code>

<h4>Parameters</h4>
    * <var>$settingName</var> - 
    * <var>$callback</var> - 
    * <var>$data</var> -
